document.docAuthor: Khaustov, Alexander A. & Frolov, Andrey V.
document.docTitle: Athyreacarus grandis Khaustov & Frolov 2019, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the genus Athyreacarus (Acari: Athyreacaridae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the genus Athyreacarus (Acari: Athyreacaridae)

subSubSection.paragraph: Description . Female ( Figs 1–7 ). Body elongate, almost fusiform. Length of idiosoma 505 (460–575), width 275 (250–300). This is one of the largest known heterostigmatic mite species.

Gnathosoma
( Figs 6B , 7A ). Gnathosomal capsule, excluding palps, almost oval, length 53 (50–55), width 57 (52–57). Dorsally with one pair of barbed, blunt-ended cheliceral setae cha 23 (21–27). Postpalpal setae ( pp ) 12 (12–13). Subcapitular setae m 10 (9–11) and n 55 (53–62) ( Fig. 7A ) smooth. Setae m blunt-ended, n pointed. Setae dFe 28 (15–30) and dGe 39 (32–40) smooth and pointed. Tibial claw well-developed, slightly hooked.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 4 . Phase-contrast micrographs of
Athyreacarus grandis
sp. nov.
, female: A—general aspect dorsally, B—general aspect ventrally.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Idiosomal dorsum ( Figs 1A , 4A , 5B , 6 A–E). All dorsal shields with numerous dimples ( Fig. 5B ). Central part of tergite C in some specimens with very weak subcuticular reticulation. Dorsal shields wide, almost completely covering idiosoma. Prodorsal shield without lateral projections, setae
v 2
and sc 1 vestigial ( Fig. 6D ). Setae sc 2 , c 2 , d , f , h 1 , and h 2 with distinctly thickened basal half. Setae e short, spiniform. Setae c 1 absent. All dorsal setae smooth. Setae e usually blunt-ended, other dorsal setae pointed. Cupules ia on tergite D, im , ip on tergite EF and ih on tergite H small, round. Cupules ih located lateroventrally. Pseudanal segment unusually long, only slightly shorter than tergite H. Lengths of dorsal setae:
v 1 95
(75–97), sc 2 51 (43–53), c 2 50 (46–55), d 44 (47–49), e 7 (6–10), f 33 (32–38), h 1 33/39 (23–40), h 2 36/52 (22–52). Distances between setae:
v 1 –v 1 44
(44–50),
v 2 –v 2
105 (105–120), sc 1 –sc 1 115 (115–130), sc 2 –sc 2 92 (88–93), c 2 – c 2 185 (170–200), d–d 97 (88–100), e–e 98 (95–105), f–f 84 (83–93), h 1 – h 1 70 (70–82), h 1 – h 2 18 (17–29).

Idiosomal venter ( Figs 1B , 4B , 5A, C, D , 6F , 7 B–D). All ventral plates with numerous dimples ( Fig. 5A, C, D ), dimples on aggenital and midsternal plates located more densely than on other plates. All ventral setae smooth and pointed, sometimes seta ag 1 blunt-ended. Ap5 short, located near base of legs IV . Aggenital plate with two pairs of aggenital setae. Anal opening terminal, with long anal valves forming cone-like structure. Length of mid-sternal plate 110 (105–120), width 90 (83–95); ratio length/width 1.2–1.3. Lengths of ventral setae: 1 a 62 (45–63), 1 b 22/44 (22–61), 1 c 45 (33–46), 2 a 74 (65–80), 2 b 54 (53–61), 2 c 36 (29–50), 3 a 35/47 (30–55), 3 b 61 (49–67), 3 c 53/70 (43–70), 4 a 54 (53–63), 4 b 60 (54–71), 4 c 36 (28–44), ag 1 34/45 (32–54), ag 2 77 (76–125), ps 1 160 (150–195), ps 2 155/170 (145–180), ps 3 120/145 (120–170).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 5 . Phase-contrast micrographs of
Athyreacarus grandis
sp. nov.
, female: A—left half of anterior sternal plate, B—
right half of tergites EF and H, C—left coxal fields III and IV , D—aggenital and part of pseudanal plates; note left seta ag 1 short and blunt-ended, right long and pointed.

FIGURE 6 . SEM micrographs of
Athyreacarus grandis
sp. nov.
, female: A—general aspect dorsally, B—anterior part of prodorsal shield and gnathosoma in dorsal view, C—prodorsal shield, D—right part of prodorsal shield, E—tergites EF, H, and pseudanal segment in dorsal view, F—general aspect ventrally.

subSubSection.paragraph: Legs ( Figs 2 , 3 , 7E, F ). Length of legs: I 170 (165–190), II 200 (185–215), III 260 (255–295), IV 345 (340– 380). Leg I ( Figs 2A , 7E ): all leg setae smooth; setae l’ , v’ of femur, v’ , l” of genu, l” and k of tibia, and pv” of tarsus blunt-ended; other leg setae (except eupathidia) pointed; setae ( pl ) weakly thickened and flattened subapically; lengths of solenidia ω 1 15 (15–16), ω 2 11 (11–12), φ 1 10 (10–12), φ 2 10 (9–10); ω 1 and ω 2 digitiform, φ 1 and φ 2 weakly clavate. Leg II ( Figs 2B , 7E ): solenidion ω 15 (14–15), digitiform solenidion φ 11 (11–12) baculiform; setae d of femur and tibia, ( u ) and ( tc ) of tarsus smooth, other leg setae weakly barbed; setae l’ , v’ of femur and ( tc ) of tarsus blunt-ended; other leg setae pointed; setae ( tc ) of tarsus distinctly spatulate distally. Leg III ( Figs 3A , 7F ): similar in shape and length to leg II ; solenidion φ 10 (10–13) baculiform; setae v’ of trochanter, d , v’ of femur, d of tibia, ( u ) and ( tc ) of tarsus smooth, other leg setae weakly barbed; seta v’ of femur, ( l ), v’ of genu, l’ of tibia and ( tc ) of tarsus blunt-ended; other leg setae pointed; setae ( tc ) of tarsus distinctly spatulate distally ( Fig. 7F ). Leg IV ( Fig. 3B ): solenidion φ 10 (10–12) baculiform; setae v’ of trochanter, d , v’ of femur, d of tibia and tc’ of tarsus smooth, other leg setae weakly barbed; seta v’ of trochanter, v’ of femur, v’ , l” of genu, l ’, ( v ) of tibia, p’ and tc’ of tarsus blunt-ended; other leg setae pointed; seta tc’ of tarsus distinctly spatulate distally.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 7 . SEM micrographs of
Athyreacarus grandis
sp. nov.
, female: A—gnathosoma in ventral view, B—anterior sternal plate, C—metapodosoma in ventral view, D—opisthosoma in ventral view, E—tibia and tarsus of legs I and II in dorsal view, F—tibia and tarsus of leg III in dorsal view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material .
Female holotype , slide No. 1734.1, BRASIL , Mato Grosso , Itiquira , Fazenda Espigão ,
10.I.2013
, T. Semedo leg., on a beetle
Neoathyreus lanuginosus
( Klug )
. Paratypes
:
16 females , same data
;
18 females , BRA- SIL, Minas Gerais , Conceição dos Ouros , Rio Sapucaí-Mirim ,
860 m
, on a beetle
N. lanuginosus
;
21 females , BRASIL , Minas Gerais , Fazenda Costinha ,
I.1994
, F.Z.Vaz-de-Mello leg., on a beetle
N. lanuginosus
.

Type deposition . The holotype and seven paratypes are deposited in the collection of UNESP—Universidade Estadual Paulista, Department of Zoology and Botany, 15054—000 São José do Rio Preto—SP, Brazil ; 20 paratypes are deposited in the collection of the Tyumen State University Museum of Zoology , Tyumen , Russia ; 10 paratypes are deposited in the collection of the Zoological Institute of RAS, Saint Petersburg , Russia .

Differential diagnosis . The new species is most similar to
A. pleiotretus Lindquist, Kaliszewski and Rack, 1990
by the absence of setae c 1 and vestigial setae
v 2 .
The new species differs from
A. pleiotretus
by setae sc 2 , c 2 , d , f , h 1 , and h 2 with distinctly thickened basal half (vs. not thickened in
A. pleiotretus
) ( Figs. 54A, B ), spiniform setae e (vs. not modified in
A. pleiotretus
) ( Fig. 54B ), and small dimples on segment ps , which do not differ from dimples on tergite H and aggenital plate (vs large dimples, distinctly larger than on tergite H and aggenital plate in
A. pleiotretus
) ( Figs. 54 B, D ).

Etymology . The name of the new species is derived from Latin “
grandis
” meaning “ large ” and refers to its very large body size.
